titles.title: To provide for enhanced retirement benefits for administrative law judges.
Administrative Law Judges Retirement Act of 2007
Administrative Law Judges Retirement Act of 2007

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Federal Workforce, Post Office, and the District of Columbia.

term.name: Government employee pay, benefits, personnel management

bill.summary: Administrative Law Judges Retirement Act of 2007 - Sets forth separate provisions governing Government and employee contributions, annuity eligibility requirements (ten years of service and age 60), early retirement, and annuity computation (2.5% and 1.7%, respectively, of average pay for each year of service) for administrative law judges under the Civil Service Retirement System and the Federal Employees' Retirement System.
